string.name: decks
string.comment: A list of cards. What the user select to choose what to review.

string.name: card_browser
string.comment: The screen in which you can search for cards, select some and edit them.

string.name: statistics
string.comment: The screen where you can see aggregated informations about your review history.

string.name: settings
string.comment: The screen where the user can change global parameter .

string.name: help
string.comment: A button to get some information. Either global help for AnkiDroid or help for a specific context.

string.name: send_feedback
string.comment: The screen allowing user to send feedbacks to the AnkiDroid team.

string.name: studyoptions_title
string.comment: Title of the page showing information about current deck.

string.name: studyoptions_due_today
string.comment: Label in deck overview for the number of cards that are going to be due today.

string.name: studyoptions_new_total
string.comment: Label in deck overview for the number of new cards (for today or later) in selected deck.

string.name: studyoptions_total_cards
string.comment: Label in deck overview for the total number of cards in the selected deck.

string.name: studyoptions_eta
string.comment: Label in the deck overview for the estimated time the user will spend reviewing this deck.

string.name: studyoptions_start
string.comment: Label of the button to move from overview and start studying.

string.name: expand
string.comment: Description of the action done in the deck picker, i.e. expanding subdecks of a deck. Used for accessibility.

string.name: collapse
string.comment: Description of the action done in the deck picker, i.e. collapsing subdecks of a deck. Used for accessibility.

string.name: study_more
string.comment: Link to invite users to increase the number of card they'll study today in a deck.

plurals.name: deckpicker_title
plurals.comment: Message under AnkiDroid in the main screen.

plurals.name: reviewer_window_title
plurals.comment: Shown in reviewer to indicates how much time is expected to be spent in it, in minutes (at most 59).

plurals.name: reviewer_window_title_hours
plurals.comment: Shown in reviewer to indicates how much time is expected to be spent in it, in hours (at most 23) and minutes.

plurals.name: reviewer_window_title_days
plurals.comment: Shown in reviewer to indicates how much time is expected to be spent in it, in days and hours.

string.name: no_cards_placeholder_title
string.comment: Message displayed on start, before the user adds they first cards or decks, to explain why they can't start reviewing yet.

string.name: no_cards_placeholder_description
string.comment: Message displayed on start, to explain to the user how to start creating cards to learn.

plurals.name: studied_cards_today
plurals.comment: Message in deck picker telling the user how much time was spent and how much card reviewed today.

string.name: type_answer_hint
string.comment: In the reviewer, for cards where you should type the answer. This is the text displayed in the field while it's empty, to indicate the field purpose.

string.name: show_answer
string.comment: In the reviewer, on question side. Label of the button which should be pressed to show the answer.

string.name: hide_answer
string.comment: In previewer, inverse of 'show_answer'; goes back to question side of the card.

string.name: ease_button_again
string.comment: In the reviewer, on the answer side. Label of the left-most button.

string.name: ease_button_hard
string.comment: In the reviewer, on the answer side. Label of the second button in most case.

string.name: ease_button_good
string.comment: In the reviewer, on the answer side. Label of the default button.

string.name: ease_button_easy
string.comment: In the reviewer, on the answer side. Label of the right-most button.

string.name: studyoptions_congrats_undo
string.comment: Label of button inviting to undo, and explaining what will be undone.

string.name: menu_import
string.comment: Label of the 'import' menu entry in deck picker.

string.name: undo
string.comment: Label of the 'undo' button in card browser, reviewer and study option.

string.name: undo_action_review
string.comment: Label indicating that, if you press undo, it'll undo the last review.

string.name: undo_action_bury_card
string.comment: Label indicating that, if you press undo, it'll undo burying a card.

string.name: undo_action_bury_note
string.comment: Label indicating that, if you press undo, it'll undo the burying a note.

string.name: undo_action_suspend_card
string.comment: Label indicating that, if you press undo, it'll undo the suspension of a card.

string.name: undo_action_suspend_note
string.comment: Label indicating that, if you press undo, it'll undo the suspension of a note.

string.name: undo_action_delete
string.comment: Label indicating that, if you press undo, it'll undo the deletion of a note.

string.name: undo_action_delete_multi
string.comment: Label indicating that, if you press undo, it'll undo the deletion of notes.

string.name: undo_action_change_deck_multi
string.comment: Label indicating that, if you press undo, it'll undo changing decks of cards.

string.name: undo_action_reschedule_card
string.comment: Label indicating that, if you press undo, it'll undo the rescheduling of card(s).

string.name: undo_action_reset_card
string.comment: Label indicating that, if you press undo, it'll undo resetting the progress of card(s).

string.name: undo_action_reposition_card
string.comment: Label indicating that, if you press undo, it'll undo the repositioning card(s).

string.name: move_all_to_deck
string.comment: Label indicating that, if you press undo, it'll undo the move of cards.

string.name: unbury
string.comment: Label of the menu item which unbury the cards of a deck.

string.name: rename_deck
string.comment: Label of the menu item which rename a deck..

string.name: menu_add_note
string.comment: Label of the menu item to add notes from the reviewer. Same effect as menu_add but displayed in the reviewer.

string.name: menu_dismiss_note
string.comment: In reviewer's option, label of the part of the menu dealing with all options removing a card from reviewer today. I.e. suspend, bury and delete.

string.name: menu_bury_card
string.comment: Label of the reviewer's menu entry to bury current card.

string.name: menu_bury_note
string.comment: Label of the reviewer's menu entry to bury the note of current card.

string.name: menu_suspend_card
string.comment: Label of the reviewer's menu entry to suspend current card.

string.name: menu_suspend_note
string.comment: Label of the reviewer's menu entry to suspend current note.

string.name: menu_bury
string.comment: Label of the reviewer's menu entry to bury. It'll ask whether to bury card or note if it's relevant. Also the label in the preference regarding the bury button.

string.name: menu_suspend
string.comment: Label of the reviewer's menu entry to bury. It'll ask whether to suspend card or note if it's relevant. Also the label in the preference regarding the suspend button.

string.name: menu_delete_note
string.comment: Label of the reviewer's menu entry to delete the note. Also the label in the preference regarding the delete button.

string.name: menu_flag_card
string.comment: Label of the reviewer/card browser's menu entry to select which flag to add to a card. Also the label of the preference entry related to this menu entry.

string.name: menu_flag_card_zero
string.comment: Label of the reviewer/card browser's menu entry to remove the card(s)'s flag.

string.name: menu_flag_card_one
string.comment: Label of the reviewer/card browser's menu entry to add the red flag to the current/selected card(s).

string.name: menu_flag_card_two
string.comment: Label of the reviewer/card browser's menu entry to add the orange flag to the current/selected card(s).

string.name: menu_flag_card_three
string.comment: Label of the reviewer/card browser's menu entry to add the green flag to the current/selected card(s).

string.name: menu_flag_card_four
string.comment: Label of the reviewer/card browser's menu entry to add the blue flag to the current/selected card(s).

string.name: menu_edit_tags
string.comment: Label of the menu item (and its preference entry) which open the window with a list of tag, allowing you to add/remove already existing tag to the note.

string.name: delete_note_message
string.comment: The message shown to the user when they click on the delete note button.

resources.string: Really delete this note and all its cards?\n%s

string.name: menu_select
string.comment: TODO: what is it ?.

string.name: menu_search
string.comment: TODO: Not used yet ?.

string.name: menu_mark_note
string.comment: Label of the menu item (and its preference entry) which mark the current note (i.e. add the yellow star).

string.name: menu_unmark_note
string.comment: Label of the menu item (and its preference entry) which unmark the current note (i.e. remove the yellow star).

string.name: menu_toggle_mic_tool_bar
string.comment: Label of the menu item (and its preference entry) which add a recorder/player, to let user hear themselves pronunce something. Represented as a mic.

string.name: new_deck
string.comment: Title of the window inviting to create a deck, and label of the button to open this window.

string.name: new_dynamic_deck
string.comment: Label of the menu item in deck picker inviting to create a filtered deck.

string.name: night_mode
string.comment: Label near the switch between night and day mode.

string.name: directory_inaccessible
string.comment: An error message explaining that the directory can't be accessed.

string.name: startup_no_storage_permission
string.comment: This is shown when AnkiDroid starts up with no storage permissions. The user is taken to the "App Info" screen, and needs to click "Permissions" and grant AnkiDroid the 'Storage' permission. This needs to be a fairly generic message as implementations of the permissions/app info screen will differ between devices.

resources.string: Please grant AnkiDroid the ‘Storage’ permission to continue

string.name: rebuild_cram_deck
string.comment: Label of meny entry offering to rebuild a cram deck.

string.name: empty_cram_label
string.comment: Label of the menu item inviting to empty the cram deck.

string.name: create_subdeck
string.comment: Title of the window offering the user to create a subdeck of the deck they selected. label of the menu item opening this window.

string.name: empty_cram_deck
string.comment: Message explaining to the user that the cram deck is getting emptied.

string.name: custom_study_deck_name
string.comment: Default name of a custom study deck.

string.name: custom_study_deck_exists
string.comment: The user just tried to create a custom study deck. However a deck with the default name of custom study deck exists. This message explain this existing deck should be renamed before the user can create a new custom study deck.

resources.string: Rename the existing custom study deck first

string.name: invalid_deck_name
string.comment: Warns user they entered a deck name which is not valid. Currently, that only means that it contains only whitespace, tab and other invisible characters.

string.name: studyoptions_empty
string.comment: Message shown to the user when the select a deck to review and this deck is empty.

resources.string: This deck is empty. Press the + button to add new content.

string.name: studyoptions_limit_reached
string.comment: Message shown when the user select a deck, no card can be seen now because of daily limit, however there remain new cards or card due today in the deck.

string.name: studyoptions_empty_schedule
string.comment: Message shown when a user select a deck, and there is no new card nor any card in learning, or review card due today.

string.name: studyoptions_congrats_finished
string.comment: Message shown to user when the reviewer closed because there is no more card to see.

resources.string: Congratulations! You have finished for now.

string.name: studyoptions_congrats_more_rev
string.comment: Message shown to the user when there are card to review in the selected deck, due today, but can't be seen because of the daily limit.

resources.string: Today’s limit has been reached, but there are still cards to review. You can increase the limit in the options.

string.name: studyoptions_congrats_more_new
string.comment: Message shown to the user when there are new card(s) in the selected deck that can't be seen because of the daily limit.

resources.string: Today’s limit has been reached. There are more new cards available; you can increase the limit in the options, but this will increase your short-term review workload.

string.name: studyoptions_congrats_custom
string.comment: Message explaining that more cards can be reviewed by creating a custom study session.

resources.string: To study outside of the normal schedule, touch the “Custom study” button

string.name: studyoptions_no_cards_due
string.comment: Message shown to the user when there are cards in learning due later, that can't be shown yet.

string.name: sd_card_not_mounted
string.comment: Message shown to user when the card on which data is supposed to be saved can't be accessed.

string.name: empty_cloze_warning
string.comment: Message shown on the question side telling when the note type is cloze, but there are no cloze deletion in the cloze field.

resources.string: Edit this note and add some cloze deletions. (%1$s)

string.name: button_sync
string.comment: Label of the sync button (for accessibility) and of the sync android activity (A theoretical button on android which would start a sync).

string.name: cancel_sync_confirm
string.comment: Message shown when the user press on cancel during sync.

resources.string: Do you want to cancel the sync?

string.name: continue_sync
string.comment: In the box asking the user whether they want to cancel sync, this is the label of the button which state that sync is not cancelled.

string.name: sync_cancelled
string.comment: Message confirming to user that the sync was correctly cancelled as they requested.

string.name: sync_cancel_message
string.comment: Message shown to user when they requested cancellation of sync, stating that this is ongoing.

string.name: export
string.comment: Title of the export dialog. That is, the dialog that the user create by selecting Export deck or by selecting from the deck picker menu.

string.name: export_collection
string.comment: Label of the deckpicker's menu item. When clicked, it allows user to export their whole collection.

string.name: export_deck
string.comment: Label of the menu item, obtained when pressing a deck, allowing to export this deck.

string.name: nothing
string.comment: When a user want to change the type of a note, they are asked for each field/card type to which field/card they want to send it. This is the label of the option which states that the field/card should be deleted.

string.name: title_activity_template_editor
string.comment: Title of the window in which the user can edit the card types.

string.name: card_template_editor_front
string.comment: In the Card Type window: label explaining that the text field below contains the template of the front of this card type.

string.name: card_template_editor_back
string.comment: In the Card Type window: label explaining that the text field below contains the template of the back of this card type.

string.name: card_template_editor_styling
string.comment: In the Card Type window: label explaining that the text field below contains the css of this card type.

string.name: card_template_editor_menu_delete
string.comment: Label of the menu item in card template editor which allow to delete the card type.

string.name: card_template_editor_menu_card_browser_appearance
string.comment: The label of the menu item in card template editor which allow to change the apparence of the card in the card browser.

string.name: card_template_editor_deck_override
string.comment: The label of the menu item, in card template editor, which allow to set the deck in which the card of this card type goes when they are created. This override the current deck selection when creating cards.

string.name: card_template_editor_cant_delete
string.comment: Message shown to the user when they try to delete the last card type of a note type.

resources.string: At least one card type is required

plurals.name: card_template_editor_confirm_delete
plurals.comment: Ask the user to confirm they want to delete a card type, giving them the card type name and the number of existing card of this type.
plurals.item: Delete the “%2$s” card type, and its %1$d card?
Delete the “%2$s” card type, and its %1$d cards?

string.name: invalid_template
string.comment: In the previewer of card template, warn the user that the generation did not occurs.

resources.string: A card could not be generated

string.name: card_template_editor_would_delete_note
string.comment: In the card template editor, after the user requested to delete a card type, tells them this can't be done because otherwise a note would have no card left.

resources.string: Removing this card type would cause one or more notes to be deleted. Please create and save a new card type first.

string.name: card_template_editor_save_error
string.comment: In the card template editor, warn the user their change were not saved because of the reason in the parameter.

resources.string: Unable to save card template changes: %s

string.name: template_for_current_card_deleted
string.comment: If the user opened a card to edit, then edited the note type by deleting the card type of the current card, then the editor mus close. This warn the user that the editor is closing because they are looking at a card whose type does not exists anymore.

resources.string: The card type for the current card was deleted.

string.name: read_write_permission_label
string.comment: If an external app asks to interact with Ankidroid and require to change the collection, then this is the short description that the user will see to explain what authorization they are granting to the other app.

resources.string: Read and write to the AnkiDroid database

string.name: read_write_permission_description
string.comment: If an external app asks to interact with Ankidroid and require to change the collection, then this is the long description that the user will see to explain what authorization they are granting to the other app.

resources.string: access existing notes, cards, note types, and decks, as well as create new ones

string.name: card_browser_label
string.comment: If the user add a button on android which opens directly the card browser, then this is the string labelling the button.

string.name: card_browser_context_menu
string.comment: Label of the menu item proposing to open to open the card browser when some text is selected. TODO: check.

string.name: context_menu_anki_card_label
string.comment: TODO: what does it label ?.
